intro: Sison flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible sison, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round fruits. Sison flexuosum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
